description: Drain placed into the biliary system (e.g. percutaneous cholecystostomy)
Documented direct venous/arterial blood loss from a surgery. This is distinct from GI bleeding or bleeding from a drain.
Includes longerm, durable pleural catheters (e.g. PleurX)
Small- or large-bore chest tube draining the pleural space. Does not include tunneled/indwelling catheters
GI output from a colostomy
Quantified upper GI output directly from the patient's mouth
External urine collection systems such as PureWicks
GI output from a gastrojejunostomy
GI output from a gastrostomy
Quantified upper GI output from a GI source not otherwise specified
GI output from an ileostomy
Urine output obtained via indwelling catheter (e.g. Foley)
GI output from a jejunostomy
Urine output obtained via nephrostomy tube
GI output from a nasogastric or orogastric tube
GI output from a nasojejunal or orojejunal tube
Any additional fluid output not captured by the above
Fluid removed in a single procedure without an indwelling drain
GI output from an ostomy connecting the GI tract to the skin but not accounted for in another category
Fluid removed from the peritoneum via paracentesis
Drain placed into the pericardial space
Drain placed into the peritoneal space to drain ascites (distinct from abscess or other drainage) or PD fluid
Drain placed into other body cavity (e.g. JP drain in a abdominal abscess) outside the alimentary canal
GI output from a fecal management system to quantify stool via a rectal tube
Quantified respiratory system output (e.g. hemoptysis, epistaxis)
Quantified stool output directly from the patient
Urine output obtained via surgically inplanted suprapubic catheter
Fluid removed from the pleural space via thoracentesis
Net ultrafiltration from dialysis via ultrafiltration. Do not include removal of replacement fluid in CVVH or CVVHDF as this should be accounted for already.
Urine output flowing through urethra
Urine output obtained via urostomy
Other urinary diversion (e.g. ureterostomy)
Drain connected to a wound (e.g. wound vac)
